intro: Sanicula septentrionalis var. nemoralis, commonly known as the northern cow-weed, is a flowering plant native to eastern North America. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, wooded areas and thrives in partial to full shade. Its root system is fibrous, and it produces small, dry fruits that contain seeds. It plays a role in supporting local pollinators and is often found in forest understories.
